Output 1.1 Specific guidelines and standards on low-carbon alternatives and utilization technologies for agro-waste and wastewater developed and disseminated Planned timeline: Jan 2020 – Dec 2020 1. Development of Biogas Standards - Standards undergoing at final editing stage – BOS836 and BOS/ISO 20675 and presented to Technical Advisory Committee. 2. 1. Development of Green Certification Framework - tender bid evaluated by end of the year. award of tender expected to be done in 2021. 3. Development of Ministry of Environment Wastepaper recovery project - RFQ for waste bins and clear plastics sent out, closing on 11th Dec., Training of cleaners and waste collectors in Ministries undertaken, RFQ for waste separation animation video and banners sent out. tender award to be done in 2021.
Output 1.5 1. Support provided to Water Utilities Corporation (WUC) and Department of Waste Management and Pollution Control (DWMPC) to improve monitoring and enforcement of Trade Effluent Agreements (TEA) between industries and local authorities 1. 259 out of 500 TEA copies have been signed 2. Inspections in Francistown and Gaborone done monthly except (August and September 2020) with 10 adhoc inspections carried out due to reported blockages 3. Limited water quality sampling & analysis done over 8 months due to lack of equipment. 4. 6 out of 20 major polluters inspected comply 5. 8 out of 12 Industries that were disconnected were later given waivers to continue operation
Outputs 1.8: Financial institutions trained on best practices in assessing and financing agro-waste projects through BITRI. Planned timeline: June 2020 – December 2020 1. Various financial institutions were workshopped on renewable energy financing as well as accessing concenssional and climate financing in Jan 2020 through MMGE, World Bank partnership 2. NDB further trained in September 2020 3. Specific training on biogas planned training for NDB to be implemented second week of December 4. Training of NDB to be undertaken in January 2021.
Output 1.9 Dedicated investment facilitation platform on low-carbon waste-utilisation technologies established at BITRI, and operational with independent budget Planned timeline: July 2020 – December 2020 1. MOU between DOE and NDB on corporation in RE signed. 2. The Project through the DOE engagement with NDB have developed a financing model which focuses on the NDB existing funding platforms to be rolled out in January 2021.
